nodes.bodyText: This was all extracted from DDAgentApi
Great. Will come in handy with error logging going to the agent as well.
We've basically agreed not to do protobuf now, so this class will probably be deleted soon
Used for metrics where we expect payloads to be small, but to grow to accommodate an entire payload in a single buffer. This will go away entirely if we start streaming.
Just allows the option not to do the trick where we write the array header at the start of the buffer before publishing it, which is only relevant for trace payloads.
I thought this was better than having lots of flags, but plan to simplify this as much as possible in another PR.
Moved out of DDAgentApi so it can be used elsewhere.

This is basically a queue conflation mechanism, betting that items added to the queue are usually similar to those recently added to the queue, which should keep queue length short. On the other hand, the processor should be quite fast so conflation may not be appropriate.
This is a single threaded processor because DDSketch (which will be processed here) doesn't have any concurrency control, and nor does LRUCache
Batch is quite heavy so they're pooled. When they've been used they get put back on this queue.
We've talked about doing object pooling on other classes too.  Perhaps we should create a proper abstraction for it?

So I would love if the comments used a few more words, and said something about it being fine to overwrite the entry in the pending map, since it had already been added to the inbox queue, or similar.
So the errorMask is not used, but I guess this is the place where the separation of error and normal durations would happen.
Since this class seems specific to metrics/stats, consider clarifying that in the class name.
I aim for its responsibilities to grow until it strangles the other one which got a bit bent out of shape at some point
